searchInFiles

public static SearchManager.MatchingPositions searchInFiles(SearchManager.BackgroundSearch bgs,
                                                            java.lang.String base,
                                                            boolean recursive,
                                                            boolean ignoreCR,
                                                            java.lang.String filePattern,
                                                            boolean fileCaseSensitive,
                                                            java.lang.String wordPattern,
                                                            boolean wordCaseSensitive,
                                                            boolean wholeWord,
                                                            boolean regexp)
Search a word (with a pattern) in files selected according to their name.

Parameters:
base - the base directory
recursive, - if true then a recursive search is made
ignoreCR, - if true then the read file is considered as one line and regex pattern can include \n
filePattern - the pattern to use to select the files. * is equivalent to .* and ? to .?
fileCaseSensitive, - if true then the file pattern is case sensitive
wordPattern - the pattern of the word to search
wordCaseSensitive, - if true then the word pattern is case sensitive
wholeWord, - if true only whole word will be matched, e.g. in "foobar foo bar", if the pattern is "foo", then only the second "foo" will be matched
regexp, - if true the word pattern is considered as a regex
Returns:
infos with the matching positions

searchInFiles

public static SearchManager.MatchingPositions searchInFiles(boolean[] killed,
                                                            java.io.File base,
                                                            boolean recursive,
                                                            boolean ignoreCR,
                                                            java.util.regex.Pattern file,
                                                            java.util.regex.Pattern word)
Search a word (with a pattern) in files selected according to their name.

Parameters:
base - the base directory
recursive, - if true then a recursive search is made
ignoreCR, - if true then the read file is considered as one line and regex pattern can include \n
filePattern - the pattern to use to select the files. * is equivalent to .* and ? to .?
word - the pattern of the word to search
killed - a boolean array with more than one element. It is used as a reference on a boolean set to true if the process is killed.
Returns:
infos with the matching positions

searchWordInFile

public static SearchManager.MatchingPositions searchWordInFile(java.io.File f,
                                                               java.util.regex.Pattern pat)
Search a word (with a pattern) in a file. The search is made line by line.

Parameters:
file - the file where to search
pat - the pattern of the word to search
Returns:
infos with the matching positions

searchWordInFileIgnoringCR

public static SearchManager.MatchingPositions searchWordInFileIgnoringCR(java.io.File f,
                                                                         java.util.regex.Pattern pat)
Search a word (with a pattern) in a file. The file content is considered as one line (useful to search "...\n...")

Parameters:
file - the file where to search
pat - the pattern of the word to search
Returns:
infos with the matching positions
